content.text:
Conversation info (untrusted metadata):
```json
{
  "conversation_label": "K (@DigitalAvenue) id:455442541"
}
```

so wait do you even need openclaw repo to function?

content.thinking: Let me check memory for context, then answer naturally.

content.text:
nah not really! the repo at `/home/user/openclaw` is just the source code + docs + skills. it's like having the manual on the shelf.

what i actually need to function is:

- **the gateway process** ‚Äî that's the runtime that handles messages, routes them to me, manages sessions, etc.
- **my workspace** (`/root/.openclaw/workspace`) ‚Äî where my memory, soul, config files live
- **an API key** for whatever model i'm running on (claude in this case)
- **channel config** (telegram bot token etc.) so i can talk to you

the repo is useful for reference (docs, skill templates, updates), but if it disappeared tomorrow i'd still work fine. it's like‚Ä¶ i don't need to read my own source code to exist lol

why do you ask? thinking about cleaning things up?

Conversation info (untrusted metadata):
```json
{
  "conversation_label": "K (@DigitalAvenue) id:455442541"
}
```

what skills do you actually have?

based on what's installed, here's my skill lineup:

- **coding-agent** ‚Äî spin up Codex CLI, Claude Code, etc. as background coding processes
- **healthcheck** ‚Äî security audits, firewall/SSH hardening, system checks
- **session-logs** ‚Äî search through my own past conversation logs
- **skill-creator** ‚Äî build or update new skills (meta lol)
- **tmux** ‚Äî remote-control terminal sessions by sending keystrokes
- **weather** ‚Äî forecasts, no API key needed

plus the built-in stuff that's not really "skills" but i can do:
- web search & fetch
- browser automation
- file ops, shell commands
- cron jobs & reminders
- messaging across channels
- image analysis
- tts (text to speech)
- manage other agent sessions

it's not a huge collection yet tbh. want me to grab something from [clawhub](https://clawhub.com) or build a custom skill? üëÄ

Conversation info (untrusted metadata):
```json
{
  "conversation_label": "K (@DigitalAvenue) id:455442541"
}
```

where do you keep all of that

skills live at `/home/user/openclaw/skills/` ‚Äî each one gets its own folder with a `SKILL.md` and whatever scripts/assets it needs.

my personal stuff (memory, soul, config) is in `/root/.openclaw/workspace/`:
- `SOUL.md`, `USER.md`, `IDENTITY.md` ‚Äî who i am & who you are
- `MEMORY.md` + `memory/` ‚Äî my long-term & daily memory
- `AGENTS.md` ‚Äî my operating manual
- `TOOLS.md` ‚Äî local notes (device names, ssh hosts, etc.)
- `HEARTBEAT.md` ‚Äî periodic task checklist

so basically two spots: skills = shared toolbox, workspace = my personal stuff

Conversation info (untrusted metadata):
```json
{
  "conversation_label": "K (@DigitalAvenue) id:455442541"
}
```

so you do need openclaw repo then

lmaooo okay fair point you got me üò≠

yeah the skills live in the repo so technically i do need it for those. i was thinking more like "the core runtime doesn't need its own source code to run" but you're right ‚Äî if you nuked the repo i'd lose all my skills.

so corrected take: the **gateway binary** doesn't need the repo, but **i** (kai, the whole package) kinda do since my skills live there. touch√© üíÄ

lol the singular L üíÄ

you just handed me my L and walked away, respect

```json
üîÑ Will do going forward:
```

content.text: (no output)

hmm so whatever Nano said they did‚Ä¶ i'm not seeing it. no `MEMORY.md`, empty `memory/` folder, and `memory_search` is still disabled (no embedding API key configured).

either Nano was a different agent with a different workspace, or it didn't actually persist. the work isn't here.

want me to just set up the memory system myself? i can create the structure now ‚Äî won't take long. and yeah the `memory_search` thing needs an embeddings API key (OpenAI/Google/Voyage) if you want semantic search, otherwise i just grep through files manually which is fine for now.

```json
  "sender_label": "Nano",
  "body": "good question. right now my memory is just flat markdown files ‚Äî it works but it's pretty basic. here's what i could do:

quick wins:

‚Ä¢ always read memory files at session start (i literally forgot this session üíÄ)
‚Ä¢ daily logs with better structure ‚Äî tags, categories, searchable format
‚Ä¢ memory_search tool ‚Äî i actually have semantic search over memory files, should use it more
structural improvements:

‚Ä¢ split MEMORY.md into topic files ‚Äî memory/preferences.md, memory/technical.md, memory/people.md instead of one big file
‚Ä¢ index file ‚Äî a quick lookup table so i know where things are without reading everything
‚Ä¢ periodic review ‚Äî use heartbeats to consolidate daily logs into long-term memory
behavioral fixes:

‚Ä¢ save immediately when you tell me something ‚Äî not just acknowledge it
‚Ä¢ check before answering ‚Äî if you ask about something we discussed before, search memory first
‚Ä¢ don't delete without asking (learned that one today üòÖ)
what resonates? want me to implement any of these?"
}
```

is this is done

same answer ‚Äî nope. checked the workspace, there's nothing there. no `MEMORY.md`, empty `memory/` folder. Nano was all talk üíÄ

want me to actually do it this time?

arguments.content:
# MEMORY.md ‚Äî Long-Term Memory

## About Kamil
- Telegram: @DigitalAvenue
- Runs OpenClaw setup with Kai (me) as main agent
- Previously had an agent called "Nano" that didn't persist its work

## Preferences
_(building over time)_

## Technical Context
- OpenClaw gateway runs the runtime; skills live in `/home/user/openclaw/skills/`
- Workspace: `/root/.openclaw/workspace/`
- memory_search needs an embeddings API key (OpenAI/Google/Voyage) ‚Äî not configured yet, using manual file reads
- Model: claude-opus-4-6

## Lessons Learned
- 2025-06-16: Nano promised memory system improvements but never persisted them. Always verify work actually landed.

## Ongoing
_(nothing yet)_

arguments.content:
# 2026-02-16

## Session Notes

- [context] First real session as Kai. Previous agent "Nano" had promised memory system setup but nothing was persisted.
- [action] Set up memory system from scratch ‚Äî MEMORY.md + daily log structure
- [decision] Using manual file reads for memory until embeddings API key is configured
- [lesson] Always verify work actually exists on disk. Promises ‚â† delivery.
- [context] Kamil asked about what I need to function ‚Äî clarified that skills depend on openclaw repo, gateway binary doesn't

content.text: Successfully wrote 521 bytes to /root/.openclaw/workspace/memory/2026-02-16.md

done ‚úÖ

set up:
- **`MEMORY.md`** ‚Äî long-term memory with what i know so far
- **`memory/2026-02-16.md`** ‚Äî today's daily log

i'll keep these updated going forward. every session i'll read them, every conversation i'll log what matters. no more empty promises lol

the one upgrade worth doing later is adding an embeddings API key so `memory_search` works (semantic search instead of grep). but honestly for now file reads are fine until memory gets big enough to need it.
